text: I'm David Gordon Green the director of
the film stronger the film stars Jake
Gyllenhaal is Boston Marathon Survivor
Jeff Bowman and his on-again off-again
girlfriend was played by Tatiana maslany
this is a scene where we had the actual
doctor
dr. kaylis who amputated Jeff's legs in
real life and we had a number of
technical consultants on the film that
that ended up playing themselves and
this was an opportunity to invite dr.
Kalish to participate in the film
production and recreate this this moment
that everyone acknowledged was one of
the harder moments for Jeff to witness
both in the excruciating pain of getting
his bandages removed and his sutures
cleaned but also in exposing himself in
this vulnerability to Aaron and as Jeff
talks about it was really hard for him
to deal with the situation he didn't
want her to look at his legs and see
this and so he needed her there for
support and requested her to be there
and then this is a very difficult
emotional time and having dr. kaylis
there to talk us through it I think was
very valuable the composition we didn't
have a whole lot of time to film the
sequence and we were running out of
money in terms of our visual effects
budget so we thought let's just out of
efficiency shoot a block off shot over
the shoulder keep it soft focus so we
don't have to get to the details of
makeup and in visual effects we can just
use our prosthetic stomps there that
were made by our great makeup team and
and then live that situation as
accurately and efficiently as as it
would have existed in real life
and you know without you know
